results.title: The Artist speaks: Kenneth Armitage
results.brief_description: Kenneth Armitage, the young British sculptor, discusses his work. Examples of Armitage’s work, mostly human figures; his London studio; his collection of photographs and cuttings; how an idea from a photograph is worked on through sketches to the plaster statue ready for casting.
results.description: Kenneth Armitage, the young British sculptor, discusses his work. results.title: The Artist and his craft: woodblock printer
results.brief_description: Follow the step-by-step execution of a woodblock print by artist Lowell Naeve from initial sketch to completed edition. Emphasises the unique qualities of the medium for creative expression.

results.title: The Artificial kidney
results.brief_description: The principle of the artificial kidney was known as early as the 1920’s, but only in later years has it been possible to use it in chronic renal diseases where the kidney has completely, or very largely, ceased to function. A Swedish girl who receives treatment from the artificial kidney machine discusses the problems she faces and the possibility of a kidney transplantation. No other credits available.

results.title: The Art of the real: U.S.A. 1948 to 1968
results.brief_description: The film is about an exhibit called the “Art of the Real” at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City. It illustrates the Americans great concern for their culture and that the culture is real and moving, and sometimes controversial. It employs a variety of techniques including double exposures, vignettes, slow motion, freezes, camera movements, moving lights, etc.
results.title_for_label: The Art of the real: U.S.A. 1948 to 1968

results.title: The Art of the potter
results.creator_credit: David Outerbridge, Sidney Reichman and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: This film presents the work of English potter Bernard Leach and Japanese potter Shoji hamada. Shows each potter demonstrating and discussing his craft, beginning with the digging of clay through to its firing in a kiln. Suitable for Upper Secondary students.

results.title: The Art of the motion picture
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film defines and gives examples of the five basic elements in film making that lend themselves to artistic control by the film maker, and the critical analysis by the film “consumer”; composition, lighting, editing, filming of movement and the use of sound. The film maker uses these to express his ideas with artistic selection and sensitivity.

The film maker uses these to express his ideas with artistic selection and sensitivity.

results.title: The Art of the Japanese package
results.brief_description: This film shows some fine examples of the traditional Japanese art of packaging with natural materials. Based upon “the Art of the Japanese Package” exhibition which toured Australia in 1979-1980. Suitable for Upper Primary-Lower Secondary students.

results.title: The Art of the child
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: An exposition of child art as practised at home and at school by children of all ages. This film includes a visit to the National Exhibition of children’s art to see the variety of exciting works by young people.

results.title: The Art of Ping Pong
results.brief_description: The Art of Ping Pong, by Bristol based artist Jono Sandilands, utilises projection mapping of a ping pong table to record player interactions and create multimedia art installations.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.
